title: G Adventures offers private trips option
text:
G Adventures offers private trips option 23 July 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
G Adventures has unveiled a programme of 38 trips that can be booked as private departures. 
These itineraries are being offered to solo travellers or couples, and to groups of family or friends, up to a total of seven people, with instant quotes available. 
The company said the idea of offering private trips was to cater for clients who wanted to travel with people they knew, at the same time as having a G Adventures cultural experience. 
G Adventures managing director Brian Young added: “Agents and group travel organisers have 38 of our top-selling trips from our Classic, Comfort and Active travel styles to choose from to create a private departure. We’re a one-stop shop as our team can also book any flights. 
“Travellers can rest assured, we have 20 operational offices globally to look after their needs on-trip.” 
Trips available within the private programme include a seven-day cycling itinerary through Tuscany from Rome to Chianciano Terme, which is priced from £1,859pp for two people excluding flights. 
Another option is a 15-day Peru Panorama trip including a homestay at Lake Titicaca, climbing the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu and wildlife-spotting at the G Lodge Amazon. This costs from £3,099pp for two people. 
A seven-day Tanzania Safari Experience is priced at £3,199pp, excluding flights, for two people, including visits to parks and reserves with an expert wildlife guide. 
G Adventures has produced a Private Departures brochure and set up a special email address, groups@gadventures.com, for agents and group travel organisers.
